description: Decimal expansion of a(n) is given by the first n terms of the periodic sequence with initial period 1,2.
comments: See A037610 for a general formula. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jan 03 2013(Smoothly undulating palindromic) primes in this sequence are listed in A092696(n) = (4*10^A062209(n)-7)/33. - _M. F. Hasler_, Jul 30 2015

Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (10,1,-10).
formula: a(n) = 10*a(n-1)+(1/2)*(3+(-1)^n), with a(0)=0. Closed form: a(n)=-(1/6)+(1/22)*(-1)^n+(4/33)*10^n, with n>=1. - _Paolo P. Lava_, Jul 30 2009, typo corrected by _M. F. Hasler_, Jan 13 2013a(n) = floor((4/33)*10^n). - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jan 03 2013a(n) = 10*a(n-1)+a(n-2)-10*a(n-3). G.f.: x*(2*x+1) / ((x-1)*(x+1)*(10*x-1)). - _Colin Barker_, Apr 30 2014
